definition: to draw (e.g. a bow)/to pull/to stretch sth/to extend/to lengthen/to involve or implicate in/to attract/to lead/to guide/to leave/to provide evidence or justification for/old unit of distance equal to 10 丈[zhang4], one-thirtieth of a km or 33.33 meters
to transmit/to lead/to guide/to conduct/to direct

sentences.english: Huang said she and her teachers had been involved in designing the costumes for Universiade guides.
sentences.chinese: 黃秋蓉的同學和老師都曾參與大運引導員制服設計。

sentences.english: When the athlete breaks through the goal line, the aimer must in its behind.
sentences.chinese: 當運動員衝過終點線時，引導員必須在其後面。

sentences.english: The usher of the theater helped us find our seats.
sentences.chinese: 戲院裏的引導員幫助我們找到位子。

sentences.english: Our seven student guides also received many appreciative comments from our guests.
sentences.chinese: 我們的7個學生引導員也受到了客人們的紛紛感謝。

sentences.english: The usher took us to our seats.
sentences.chinese: 引導員領着我們找到了座位。

definition: (of a student) to work part-time (while continuing one's studies)/(of a delinquent) to be reformed through work and study

(neologism c. 2013) organized disruption of healthcare facilities or verbal and physical abuse of medical staff, by an aggrieved patient or proxies such as family members or hired thugs, typically aimed at obtaining compensation
to dismiss with severance pay/to pay sb off
(of friends or partners) to share both the honor and the disgrace (idiom)
student who also works part-time/(old) reform-school student
a tax declaration form/a tax return
fig. people who cannot afford to buy their own house
